skill.name: enact/hello-js
skill.description: A simple JavaScript greeting tool that demonstrates the Enact Protocol framework for building AI agents.
skill.summary: Simple JavaScript greeting tool for Enact Protocol
skill.author: EnactProtocol

security_audit.summary: This is a benign example skill that demonstrates basic JavaScript output functionality. All static findings were false positives: JavaScript template literals were misidentified as shell backticks, and YAML frontmatter keywords were misidentified as cryptographic terms. The code performs no file system access, network requests, or command execution.

content.value_statement: This skill provides a simple greeting capability for AI agents built with the Enact Protocol. It demonstrates basic JavaScript execution and string templating for agent interactions.
actual_capabilities: Prints a greeting message to stdout
Accepts a name parameter for personalized greetings
limitations: Output is limited to console logging

use_cases.title: Learning Enact Protocol
use_cases.description: New developers can study this skill to understand how Enact tools are structured and executed.

use_cases.title: Quick prototyping
use_cases.description: Use as a template when building new Enact skills that need simple output capabilities.

use_cases.title: Testing agent workflows
use_cases.description: Use as a smoke test to verify Enact agent setup is working correctly.
use_cases.target_user: DevOps engineers setting up agent infrastructure

prompt_templates.title: Basic greeting
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the hello-js tool to greet me

prompt_templates.title: Personalized greeting
prompt_templates.prompt: Use hello-js to greet {name} where {name} is a name you choose

prompt_templates.title: With system info
prompt_templates.prompt: Run hello-js and show me what system information it reveals

prompt_templates.title: Integration test
prompt_templates.prompt: Execute hello-js as part of a sequence that logs the output
prompt_templates.scenario: Testing output capture in agent workflows

best_practices: Use this skill as a template for building more complex Enact tools
Test output capture mechanisms when integrating into agent workflows
Verify Node.js version compatibility before deployment
anti_patterns: Do not use for production workflows requiring file system or network access
Do not assume this skill can persist data between invocations
Do not rely on this skill for security-sensitive operations

faq.question: What does this skill do?
faq.answer: It prints a greeting message along with a timestamp and Node.js version to demonstrate basic Enact tool execution.

faq.question: Can I use this in production?
faq.answer: This is an example skill for learning purposes. For production, use skills with appropriate error handling and security controls.

faq.question: How do I customize the greeting?
faq.answer: Pass a name parameter to personalize the greeting. The skill accepts an optional argument that replaces 'World' in the output.

faq.question: What tools does this skill require?
faq.answer: This skill requires Node.js to be available in the execution environment.

faq.question: Can this skill access files?
faq.answer: No, this example skill only performs console output and does not read or write files.

faq.question: How is this skill structured?
faq.answer: The skill uses a simple hello.js script with YAML frontmatter that defines the command to execute.
